intro: Helichrysum chermezonii, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which resemble small cups, and its aromatic, silver-gray foliage. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Helichrysum chermezonii is often used in ornamental gardening for its long-lasting blooms and ornamental value.
